item.description:

item.title: Git command to open branch in Bitbucket
item.description:
George Brocklehurst has a useful little script for opening GitHub at a particular commit, right from the command line. I've found this handy enough in the past that I've created an equivalent for Bitbucket, which is what I use at work.

#!/bin/bash

bitbucket_remote=$(git remote -v | /c/Bin/grep …

item.description:
Some recent performance profiling of a server application under load turned up an interesting gotcha in .Net's ConcurrentDictionary that I think is well- worth knowing about.

Problem 7

By listing the first six prime numbers: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, and 13, we can see that the 6th prime is 13.

What is the 10001st prime number?

Ah, what a nice, straightforward, unambiguous spec! If only business software specifications were so precise.

item.title: Project Euler Problem 6
item.description:
Onwards to...

Problem 6

The sum of the squares of the first ten natural numbers is,

1^2^ + 2^2^ + ... + 10^2^ = 385

The square of the sum of the first ten natural numbers is,

(1 + 2 + ... + 10)^2^ = 55^2^ = 3025

Hence the difference between the sum of the …

item.title: Magic Numbers and Other Numerical Nightmares
item.description:
There are many coding practices that are near-universally regarded as 'bad', yet somehow keep cropping up over and over again. Conditional-branch abuse (including, yes, gotos). Deep nesting. Cryptic variable names. Global variables. Tight coupling. Entangled business/presentation logic. I could go on.

Why do we keep doing it? Convenience? Laziness …

item.description:
Problem 4 is as follows:

A palindromic number reads the same both ways. The largest palindrome made from the product of two 2-digit numbers is 9009 = 91 × 99.

Find the largest palindrome made from the product of two 3-digit numbers.

item.description:
Learned from Weiqi, who learned from KageSenshi, about a Fedora Planet shell history meme - post the results of running the following command on your linux box:

history | awk '{a[$2]++ } END{for(i in a){print a[i] " " i}}' | sort -rn | head
